results.title: Schizophrenia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
The introduction of major psychotic drugs have meant that many schizophrenics can now lead normal lives in the community. These drugs however, can have severe side effects, and sometimes they can only limit the disease. This program looks at some typical case studies in schizophrenia and seeks out opinions on the use of drugs and other methods of treatment of this most frightening illness.

group_siblings.title: Summing up
group_siblings.creator_credit: Bryan Bruty, Mark Hamlyn and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Getting anxious
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Everyone suffers from anxiety occasionally but for 10% of the community anxiety can lead to helpless panic which prevents them from participating in everyday life. This program studies the effects of different types of panic disorders and, using interviews with patients, discusses the different types of treatment available.

results.title: Depression
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
We all suffer low spirits occasionally, but when depression becomes a devastating illness it can be life threatening. This program looks at the way manic depressives cope with their illness, its causes and at the type of treatment which is available to them.

results.title: Sun on the stubble
results.creator_credit: Robert Marchand, Terry Jennings, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, AFFC, ABC-TV (Australia) and FA
results.brief_description: Bruno Gunter, a 14 year-old boy from a German immigrant family grows up on a wheat farm in South Australia during the 1930’s. Even though his father is strict and an advocate of hard work, Bruno finds plenty of mischief and adventure. He has to deal with a new school teacher, the feud between Jack Ryan and Hermann Heinz as well as coping with his family. This adaptation of Thiele’s novels will delight the family as a byegone era is vividly recreated and a period of Australia’s history and heritage is bought to life. Starring Jamie Croft as Bruno, Christian Kohlund as his father and Susan Lyons as his mother. Based on four novels written by Colin Thiele.

results.title: Sumo do, Sumo don't = Shiko funjatta
results.creator_credit: Masayuki Suo, Izuru Hiraaki, Yo Yamamoto, Cabin Productions and Daiei Motion Picture Company
results.brief_description: Two students at Tokyo University, the irresponsible Shubei and the ineffectual Aoki, set out to build up the university sumo club. They coopt a sad-sack, a drag wrestler and a foreigner who refuses to “undress” in the right way, to form a team to uphold the honour of the alma mater at the forthcoming wrestling tournament. Unorthodox methods are called for. They are aided in their prodigious training regime by Masako, the screen’s first female sumo wrestler. To the familiar victory-against-all-odds theme is added an extra dimension— a serious look at how the West has radically influenced traditional Japanese culture. Cast includes Masahiro Motoki, Misa Shimizu, Naoto Takenaka and Hiromasa Taguchi. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Summerhill (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dennis Miller, Cecily Burwash and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Visits England’s progressive co-educational boarding school, Summerhill, founded by Alexander Neill a half century ago. Aims to show that students can make decisions about their studies without lessening the quality of their education.

results.title: Summerfield [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ken Hannam, Patricia Lovell and Clare Beach Films
results.brief_description: When a newcomer arrives in a small, secluded town to discover that the former teacher has disappeared, he probes into the mystery and becomes more and more intrigued by the inhabitants of a forbidding house called Summerfield. Eventually, the secrets of Summerfield are revealed in a dramatic ending with a shock twist. Directed by Ken Hannam (director of “Sunday Too Far Away”) and starring, Nick Tate, Elizabeth Alexander and John Waters, “Summerfield” was shot on location at Victoria’s Phillip and Churchill Islands.
